X.T: Scott W. Ambler's Diagrams of UML 2.0

BLIST.TITLE: Structural Diagrams
BLIST.ITEM:
Class Diagram
shows the classes of the system, their inter-relationships, and the operations and attributes of the classes
UML 2 Class Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/classDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram
UML Class Diagram Guidelineshttp://www.agilemodeling.com/style/classDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.AmblerSome guidelines to draw the diagram

Object Diagram
this is a class diagram containing no class
UML 2 Object Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/objectDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram

Component Diagram
shows the dependencies among software components, including the classifiers that specify them (for example implementation classes) and the artifacts that implement them; such as source code files, binary code files, executable files, scripts
UML 2 Component Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/componentDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram
UML Component Diagramming Guidelineshttp://www.agilemodeling.com/style/componentDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.AmblerSome guidelines to draw the diagram

Deployment Diagram
depicts a static view of the run-time configuration of hardware nodes and the software components that run on those nodes
UML 2 Deployment Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/deploymentDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram
UML Deployment Diagramming Guidelineshttp://www.agilemodeling.com/style/deploymentDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.AmblerSome guidelines to draw the diagram

Composite Structure Diagram (UML 2)
depicts the internal structure of a classifier (such as a class, component, or use case), including the interaction points of the classifier to other parts of the system
UML 2 Composite Structure Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/compositeStructureDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram

BLIST.TITLE: Behavior Diagrams
BLIST.ITEM:
Use Case Diagram
shows the relationships among actors and use cases within a system
UML 2 Use Case Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/useCaseDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram
UML Use Case Diagramming Guidelineshttp://www.agilemodeling.com/style/useCaseDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.AmblerSome guidelines to draw the diagram

Sequence Diagram
models the sequential logic, in effect the time ordering of messages between classifiers
UML 2 Sequence Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/sequenceDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram
UML Sequence Diagramming Guidelineshttp://www.agilemodeling.com/style/sequenceDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.AmblerSome guidelines to draw the diagram

Timing Diagram (UML 2)
depicts the change in state or condition of a classifier instance or role over time
UML 2 Timing Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/timingDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram

Activity Diagram
depicts high-level business processes, including data flow, or to model the logic of complex logic within a system
UML 2 Activity Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/activityDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram
UML Activity Diagramming Guidelineshttp://www.agilemodeling.com/style/activityDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.AmblerSome guidelines to draw the diagram

Interaction Overview Diagram
A variant of an activity diagram which overviews the control flow within a system or business process. Each node/activity within the diagram can represent another interaction diagram.
UML 2 Interaction Overview Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/interactionOverviewDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram

Collaboration Diagram (communication diagram in UML 2)
shows instances of classes, their interrelationships, and the message flow between them
UML 2 Communication Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/communicationDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram
UML Collaboration Diagramming Guidelineshttp://www.agilemodeling.com/style/collaborationDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.AmblerSome guidelines to draw the diagram

Statechart Diagram (state machine diagram in UML 2)
depict the dynamic behavior of an entity based on its response to events, showing how the entity reacts to various events depending on the current state that it is in
UML 2 State Machine Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/stateMachineDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram
UML State Chart Diagramming Guidelineshttp://www.agilemodeling.com/style/stateChartDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.AmblerSome guidelines to draw the diagram

BLIST.TITLE: Model Management Diagrams
BLIST.ITEM:
Packages
shows how model elements are organized into packages as well as the dependencies between packages
UML 2 Package Diagram Overviewhttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/packageDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram
Package Diagramming Guidelineshttp://www.agilemodeling.com/style/packageDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.AmblerSome guidelines to draw the diagram

BLIST.TITLE: Non UML diagrams
BLIST.ITEM:
Robustness Diagram
ensures that use cases are sufficiently robust to represent the usage requirements for the system
Robustness Diagramshttp://www.agilemodeling.com/artifacts/robustnessDiagram.htm
enHTMLScottW.Ambler2003An overview of the diagram

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Using UML is not a proof of good, worthwhile work.

X.T: Effects of Defects in UML Models â€“ An Experimental Investigation

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An experiment to see if errors in UML diagrams are detected.

X.T: Useful UML Modeling: UML's Double-Edged Sword
X.ST: Avoid overuse and misuse of the "include" and "extend" relationships

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some people wrongly tends to overuse <<include>> and <<extend>> in a Use Case Diagram, detailing down to the software structure.

X.T: UML - The good bits - Eoin Woods

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the UML diagrams and how to use them (or to not use them).
